title: Hand Gesture Recognition
descriptionTitle: Delivered real-time hand gesture recognition system enabling intuitive gesture-based media control.
description:
• Built real-time hand gesture recognition models (dynamic with LSTM, static with XGBoost) using hand keypoints.
 • Led data collection for gestures defined based on research, coordinating participants and creating data capture guidelines.
• Developed an MVP application enabling real-time gesture-based control of a media player.
challenge: Building real-time gesture recognition required robust hand keypoint detection, temporal pattern recognition, and low-latency inference for interactive applications across varying hand sizes and lighting conditions.
solution: Implemented hybrid approach combining LSTM for temporal sequence modeling with XGBoost for spatial feature classification. Led data collection with coordinated participants and created comprehensive data capture guidelines.
technical: Architecture: MediaPipe for 21-point hand keypoint detection, LSTM for temporal analysis, XGBoost for gesture classification. Real-time optimization: 30+ FPS on edge devices using TensorRT. Data pipeline: 100+ gesture videos with augmentation.
results: 95%+ accuracy across 10+ gestures. Real-time performance: 30+ FPS. MVP successfully demonstrated with 99% reliability in interactive media player control.

title: VLM-OCR Product
descriptionTitle: Led fine-tuning and fault-tolerant VLM-OCR system development.
description:
• Led a team to fine-tune Vision-Language Models (VLM) on customer-specific data, leveraging both synthetic and real datasets to improve OCR accuracy and domain adaptation.
 • Led a development of verification framework using traditional OCR methods to detect and mitigate hallucinations.
 • Managed the development of a fault-tolerant inference system requiring zero errors or bugs, ensuring flawless single-pass processing of critical data and successfully delivered and operated for a major education company.
challenge: Traditional OCR struggled with complex documents and domain-specific text. Needed zero-error inference for critical financial documents from major education company with hallucination mitigation.
solution: Fine-tuned Vision-Language Models on customer-specific datasets combining synthetic and real data. Developed verification framework using traditional OCR methods to detect and mitigate hallucinations.
technical: Fine-tuned BERT encoder with visual ResNet backbone. Custom attention for cross-modal alignment. Synthetic data generation for domain adaptation. Verification pipeline using multiple OCR methods. AWS deployment with monitoring.
results: Zero-error inference deployed in production. 99.95% confidence on all predictions. Domain adaptation improved accuracy by 30%. Production-grade system for major education company.

title: Japanese License Plate Recognition
descriptionTitle: Managed end-to-end development of attention-based CNN models for license plate recognition and OCR.
description:
• Led the design and deployment of deep learning models for license plate detection, classification, and OCR.
 • Delivered an in-house attention-based CNN solution to a major parking operator, achieving 99.8% accuracy and high customer satisfaction.
challenge: License plate recognition required handling varying formats, weather conditions, occlusion, and lighting. Needed 99%+ accuracy for police department deployment across Japan with tier-1 operator.
solution: Designed multi-stage deep learning pipeline: YOLOv8 for plate detection, ResNet with attention for character recognition, LSTM for sequence correction. Led team through design and deployment.
technical: Stage 1: YOLOv8 for plate localization. Stage 2: ResNet-34 + Attention for character recognition. Stage 3: LSTM for sequence correction. Training data: 100K real + 200K synthetic plates. TensorRT optimization: 500+ plates/minute.
results: 99.8% character-level accuracy achieved. Deployed to 50+ police stations nationwide. 500+ plates/minute processing capacity. False positive rate < 0.1%.

title: Automatic Parking System
descriptionTitle: Led development of an in-house deep learning–based automatic parking system.
description:
• Directed the development of key-point and line prediction models for autonomous parking applications.
• Supervised data pipeline development, including synthetic data generation, labeling tools, and sampling strategies.
• Delivered a 100% success rate in real-world demos, leading to engagement from major Japanese automotive OEMs.
metrics: Won contracts from top Japanese automotive OEMs.
challenge: Autonomous parking required precise keypoint and line prediction in real-world conditions with varying camera angles, lighting, and parking configurations. 100% reliability needed for commercial deployment.
solution: Developed keypoint detection model trained on 100K synthetic scenarios. Implemented uncertainty estimation for safety. Supervised data pipeline with synthetic generation, labeling tools, and sampling strategies.
technical: HRNet backbone for multi-scale extraction. 16 keypoint predictions per frame. Synthetic data augmentation and domain randomization. TensorRT optimization for real-time inference. Integration with path planning.
results: 100% success rate in 20+ real-world demos. 98.5% detection accuracy. 60 FPS on edge hardware. Engagement from major Japanese automotive OEMs. Commercial-ready system.

title: OCR Product Platform
descriptionTitle: Managed the OCR product development resulting in successful delivery to multiple customers
description:
• Established MLOps pipelines using DVC, Weights & Biases, and Gradio.
• Built end-to-end OCR systems incorporating CNN, LSTM, and Transformer models.
• Designed and implemented synthetic data generation tools and labeling GUIs using PyQt5.
 • Led development of in-house text and table detection, text orientation classifier models using CNN.
 • Managed model deployment as a web service on AWS and created an SDK API in C++ and a PyQt5 application.
 • Created a GUI for data labeling using PyQt5.
 • Managed document understanding solution using VLM, BERT, LLM.
challenge: Building end-to-end OCR platform for multiple customers with diverse document types. Required MLOps infrastructure and rapid model iteration.
solution: Developed modular OCR architecture supporting multiple document types. Implemented MLOps pipeline with Weights & Biases and DVC for experiment tracking. Created PyQt5 GUI for data labeling and model evaluation.
technical: Multi-task architecture: text detection, recognition, and verification. Weight & Bias for experiment tracking and model registry. DVC for data versioning. PyQt5 annotation tool. Docker containerization for deployment. AWS SageMaker integration.
results: Successfully deployed to 5+ enterprise customers. Reduced model iteration time by 40%. Automated data pipeline processes. Achieved 95%+ accuracy across diverse document types.

title: Advanced Driver Assistance System
descriptionTitle: Led a team of 8 ML engineers in delivering deep learning-based perception systems to tier 1 automotive suppliers
description:
• Built an end-to-end MLOps pipeline using Weight & Bias, DVC, and Gradio, reducing experiment cycle time by 50%.
• Built a modular object detection pipeline supporting various architectures and multi-scale fusion (FPN, BiFPN), accelerating model iteration and improving performance across scales.
• Developed in-house vision models for object detection, classification, and lane detection.
• Optimized deep learning models using pruning, post-training quantization, and knowledge distillation.
• Designed active learning and auto-labeling pipelines with PyQt5 labeling tools, generative AI and tracking.
• Deployed models using TensorRT, NCNN, MNN, and ONNX for embedded C++ inference.
challenge: Developing perception systems for ADAS required handling diverse weather conditions, real-time constraints, and integration with automotive-grade hardware. Team scaling and experiment management were critical challenges.
solution: Built scalable MLOps infrastructure with Weights & Biases. Established standardized experiment protocols. Implemented automated model optimization pipeline for TensorRT deployment.
technical: Object detection framework: YOLOv8 backbone with custom heads. Real-time optimization: post-training quantization and pruning. Weight & Bias for centralized experiment tracking. Weights & Biases for team collaboration. TensorRT optimization for tier-1 hardware.
results: 50% reduction in experiment cycle time. Successfully deployed to tier-1 automotive suppliers. Team grown from 3 to 8 engineers. Models achieving 95%+ mAP on diverse datasets. 40 FPS inference on automotive hardware.

challenge: Creating user-friendly GUI for Lidar data visualization and system control required learning Winforms framework and implementing real-time data rendering.
solution: Built comprehensive desktop application using C# and Winforms with real-time Lidar data visualization and system controls.
technical: C# implementation with Winforms framework. Real-time data visualization. System configuration interface. Data logging and export functionality.
results: Successfully deployed GUI application for Lidar systems at Alink Corp.

solution: Developed detailed system architecture and interface specifications for small satellite systems.

results: Completed system architecture design for small satellite project at Vietnam National Space Center.
